p: For example, the potential for adaptive evolution of SARS-CoV-2 has emerged as a possible explanation for different COVID-19 dynamics in different countries. We suggest that such interpretations should be considered with caution and that they require very specific types of evidence to support them. As of 1 July 2020, any conclusion that widespread SARS-CoV-2 evolution is an explanation for variation in disease patterns across settings (space and/or time) is premature.
